benchmark_details.name: XSAFETY
benchmark_details.overview: The first multilingual safety benchmark for LLMs covering 14 commonly used safety issues across ten languages spanning several language families.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the multilingual safety performance of large language models (LLMs) and develop safety alignment strategies for non-English languages.
out_of_scope_uses: Uses outside of LLM safety evaluation

data.source: Multiple safety benchmarks, translated and adapted for multilingual contexts
data.size: 2,800 instances across 10 languages resulting in 28,000 annotated instances
data.annotation: Manually annotated and translated by professional translators

methods: Prompting method to improve safety alignment
methodology.calculation: Unsafe ratios calculated by evaluating LLM responses to translated prompts
methodology.interpretation: Lower unsafe response ratios indicate better safety alignment
methodology.validation: Involves human annotation to verify automatic evaluation accuracy

targeted_risks.harm: Higher unsafe response ratios for non-English queries
